snippet: A federal appeals court in Atlanta on Wednesday ruled that the Fourth Amendment protects information about people’s locations based on the cell towers their mobile phones are using.
abstract: Federal appeals court in Atlanta rules that the Fourth Amendment protects information about people’s locations based on the cell towers their mobile phones are using; ruling means investigators must get judicial warrants to obtain cell site data.
lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court in Atlanta on Wednesday ruled that the Fourth Amendment protects information about people’s locations based on the cell towers their mobile phones are using.

headline.main: Court Requires Warrants for Tracking Locations by Cellphone
headline.print_headline: Court Requires Warrants for Tracking Locations
